Building on Apple macOS

  • Requirements
  • Building DJV
  • Packaging DJV

Requirements

  • OS X version 10.11 or later
  • Xcode
  • CMake (version 3.12 or later)
  • git
  • NASM

CMake, git, and NASM can be installed using Homebrew. Follow the instructions at the link to install Homebrew and then run:

> brew install git
> brew install cmake
> brew install nasm

Building DJV

First pick a directory and clone the DJV repository:

> git clone https://github.com/darbyjohnston/DJV.git

Create a new sub-directory for the build:

> mkdir djv-Debug
> cd djv-Debug

Run CMake and start the build:

> cmake ../djv -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DCMAKE_FIND_FRAMEWORK="LAST"
> make -j

To use the build add the install path to your DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH: 

> export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH:$PWD/install/lib

Try running the confidence tests to make sure everything is working OK:

> make test

Run the djv player application:

> ./build/bin/djv

Packaging DJV

Create a new sub-directory for a release build:

> mkdir djv-Release
> cd djv-Release

Run CMake and start the build:

> cmake ../djv -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DDJV_BUILD_PACKAGE=TRUE -DCMAKE_FIND_FRAMEWORK="LAST"
> make -j

Build the package:

> cmake ../djv -DDJV_THIRD_PARTY_DISABLE_BUILD=TRUE
> make package
